title: Data centre
description: A structure, or group of structures, dedicated to the centralized accommodation, interconnection and operation of information technology and network telecommunications equipment.

title: Cable landing point
description: The location where a submarine or other underwater cable makes landfall.

title: Point of Presence
description: A demarcation point, access point, or physical location at which two or more networks or communication devices share a connection.

title: Tower
description: A ground-based or rooftop structure that supports antennas for sending or receiving radio waves.

title: Internet Exchange Point
description: A physical point at which networks such as internet service providers, mobile operators and content delivery networks come together to connect and exchange internet traffic.

title: Border crossing
description: The point at which a fibre cable crosses either an international boundary or the coastline of the operatorâ€™s country.

title: Cabinet
description: An distribution cabinet to which end users are connected by a standard phone line.

title: Chamber
description: An optical cable connection chamber. Normally used to house splice closures or excess fibre optic cable.

title: Aggregation point
description: A point at which multiple fibre optic cables are spliced together. Typically located between an exchange or POP and GPON splitters or end user premises.

title: Peering point
description: A point at which two or more networks agree to exchange their traffic.

title: Add drop site
description: A point at which individual digital bit streams can be added to, or dropped from, a multiplexed signal in order to redirect bit streams between network paths.

title: Point of interconnection
description: A point at which networks interconnect. An interconnection point is a demarcation point between networks.

title: Repeater site
description: A point at which fibre optic signals are amplified or repeated. Also known as a regeneration facility.
